message_1: A certain country has three political parties, A, B, and C. In their parliament, there are 40 members. Party A has 12 seats, party B has 15 seats, and party C has the rest. How many seats does party C have in the parliament?
message_2:
To find out how many seats party C has, we need to subtract the total number of seats held by parties A and B from the total number of seats in the parliament.

Total seats in parliament = 40
Seats held by party A = 12
Seats held by party B = 15

Seats held by party C = Total seats in parliament - (Seats held by party A + Seats held by party B)
Seats held by party C = 40 - (12 + 15)
Seats held by party C = 40 - 27
Seats held by party C = 13

Party C has 13 seats in the parliament.
